item.title: Top judge sworn in as Egypt interim president
item.description: Chief justice Adly Mansour takes oath hours after democratically elected Mohamed Morsi overthrown by military.

item.title: Key players in Egypt's politics
item.description: Al Jazeera examines key players in Egypt's politics.

item.title: International reactions to Morsi's removal
item.description: World leaders weigh in after Egypt's army commander announces that president had been removed.

item.title: Despondent scenes at pro-Morsi rally
item.description: As the army takes control of Egypt, demonstrators in favour of the ousted president feel isolated and ignored.

item.title: Egypt's military shuts down news channels
item.description: Four TV channels, including Al Jazeera's Mubasher Misr, taken off air and staff detained.

item.title: Assad: My opponents failed to oust me
item.description: Syrian president says the opposition has used all tools to overthrow his regime but failed.

item.title: Family confirms Mandela on life support
item.description: The critically-ill South African iconic leader is breathing with the help of machine, according to family members.

item.title: France apologises to Bolivia over jet row
item.description: Morales's plane not allowed to country because of 'conflicting information' about passengers, says French President.

item.title: Belgium's King Albert II to abdicate
item.description: Monarch says that he will vacate throne in favour of his son, Crown Prince Philippe, on July 21.
